pizzaProgram.utils
Class DateFormatter

java.lang.Object
  pizzaProgram.utils.DateFormatter

public class DateFormatter
extends Object

This class is used to make strings that represent dates, used in the gui

Author:
IT1901 Group 3, Fall 2011

Method Detail

formatDateString

public static String formatDateString(String databaseDateTimeResultString)
Formats the stringrepresentation of a date. If the date is today, it will return only the time, else it will return the full date

Parameters:
databaseDateTimeResultString - the time/date that should be formatted
Returns:
the formatted date as a string

stripSeconds

private static String stripSeconds(String time)
Strips away the seconds in the timestring

Parameters:
time - A time string formatted like "hh:mm:ss"
Returns:
time formatted like "hh:mm"

removeMilliseconds

private static String removeMilliseconds(String time)
Strips away the milliseconds in a timestring

Parameters:
time - A time string formatted like "hh:mm:ss.mmm"
Returns:
time without milliseconds, formatted like "hh:mm:ss"

formatDate

private static String formatDate(String date)
Formats a date string

Parameters:
date - Any date string formatted like "yyyy-mm-dd"
Returns:
A date string formatted like "dd-mm" if the inserted date is 'yesterday' or earlier according to the system time, or "" is the inseted date string IS today

formatDateOnlyString

private static String formatDateOnlyString(String date)
Formats the inserted date string

Parameters:
date - A date string, formatted like "yyyy-mm-dd"
Returns:
A formatted date string, formatted like "dd-mm"

dateIsNotToday

private static boolean dateIsNotToday(String date)
determines if a date is today or not

Parameters:
date - The date to determine whether it is today, formatted like "yyyy-mm-dd"
Returns:
returns true if the inserted date is today, and false otherwise

getCurrentDate

private static int[] getCurrentDate()
Returns the current date, according to the system time

Returns:
an integer string formatted like new int[]{years, months, days}

convertDateStringToComponentValues

private static int[] convertDateStringToComponentValues(String currentDate)
Converts the date to an array containing years, months and days

Parameters:
currentDate - A string representing the current date, formatted as "yyyy-mm-dd"
Returns:
an integer array formatted like new int[]{years, months, days}
